intro: Wikstroemia austrocochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese sandarac tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and simple, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range.
